unnormalised: **Quora Post: Mental Health Apps - Are They Worth The Hype?**
normalised: **Quora Post: Mental Health Apps - Are They Worth The Hype?**

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been thinking a lot about mental well-being lately, especially with the hectic schedules we all have in Mumbai. I've seen so many ads for mental health apps popping up, promising everything from stress reduction to better sleep. Has anyone actually used them?
normalised: Hey everyone! Been thinking a lot about mental well-being lately, especially with the hectic schedules we all have in Mumbai. I've seen so many ads for mental health apps popping up, promising everything from stress reduction to better sleep. Has anyone actually used them?

unnormalised: I'm a bit skeptical. Do they really work, or are they just another way to drain our bank accounts, Rs. 499 per month for meditation sessions? I mean, I can just as easily listen to my nani's stories for free – way more calming!
normalised: I'm a bit skeptical. Do they really work, or are they just another way to drain our bank accounts, rupees four hundred and ninety nine per month for meditation sessions? I mean, I can just as easily listen to my nani's stories for free – way more calming!

unnormalised: Seriously though, I'm curious about people's experiences. Have you found an app genuinely helpful? Did it help with anxiety or depression, or even just managing stress better? Any recommendations? Preferably something that doesn't require a hefty subscription fee or access to my entire life.
normalised: Seriously though, I'm curious about people's experiences. Have you found an app genuinely helpful? Did it help with anxiety or depression, or even just managing stress better? Any recommendations? Preferably something that doesn't require a hefty subscription fee or access to my entire life.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma at NIMHANS recommended one for mindfulness exercises, but I forgot the name! It was supposed to be good for dealing with work stress, especially for those of us working in cramped offices of, say, 300 sq ft.
normalised: Doctor Sharma at N I M H A N S recommended one for mindfulness exercises, but I forgot the name! It was supposed to be good for dealing with work stress, especially for those of us working in cramped offices of, say, three hundred square feet.

unnormalised: Also, are there any apps specifically tailored for Indian users, considering our unique cultural and social contexts? Like, dealing with family pressure or societal expectations in Delhi is a whole different ball game.
normalised: Also, are there any apps specifically tailored for Indian users, considering our unique cultural and social contexts? Like, dealing with family pressure or societal expectations in Delhi is a whole different ball game.

unnormalised: Let's share our thoughts and experiences! Maybe we can create a helpful resource list for anyone looking into trying them out. Your insights could really help someone!
normalised: Let's share our thoughts and experiences! Maybe we can create a helpful resource list for anyone looking into trying them out. Your insights could really help someone!

unnormalised: What are your thoughts on the efficacy of mental health apps?
normalised: What are your thoughts on the efficacy of mental health apps?
